tips: Know your 3 key messages - everything you say should lead back to these core points
Prepare bridge phrases - learn to pivot from any question back to your messages
Practice out loud - knowing your answers intellectually is different from delivering them naturally
Research the host - understanding their style helps you adapt your delivery

faq.question: How should I prepare with this guide?
faq.answer: Review the questions and answers, internalize your key messages, then practice saying them naturally. Don't memorize word-for-word.

faq.question: What are bridge phrases?
faq.answer: Phrases like 'What's really important is...' or 'The key point here is...' that help you transition to your prepared messages.

faq.question: How many key messages should I have?
faq.answer: Aim for 3 key messages. More than that is hard to work in naturally. Make them memorable and repeatable.

faq.question: Should I send this to the host?
faq.answer: No, this is your private prep. Share a guest intro and suggested questions instead. Keep your strategic preparation private.
